description.narrative:
The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory .
Project Outcomes: Increased access to quality broadband Internet for individuals and businesses. Based on the standalone capex plan to upgrade mobile and fixed network, a preliminary assessment suggests " Strong " Project Outcomes, with a risk of a Moderate rating if savings are not reinvested or if there is no addition with respect to the current capex plan. The gap in access to quality broadband Internet in Armenia is expected to be Medium as, compared to other emerging markets, penetration and download speed of fixed or mobile broadband is on par with regional or income-group averages. Without the refinancing component, the Company may not be able to expand beyond its historical investment trend. The refinancing is expected to generate savings that, if reinvested, can support network expansion and upgrade as well as expand international connectivity. The magnitude of these outcomes will be explored in appraisal and depends on: the degree of commitment to reinvest the savings, and how these will be invested; and the incremental nature of this investment compared to the existing capex plan.
Market Creation - Subject to evidence about the expected increase in high-speed broadband coverage beyond the Company, a preliminary assessment suggests " Moderate " Contribution to Market Creation. Increased integration by strengthening international connectivity linkages or enabling digital platforms may be considered post appraisal. Increased competitiveness of the market for broadband Internet access by preserving trends in network upgrade via innovation and competition channels. The market for broadband Internet access in Armenia is fairly developed with a number of large fixed and mobile broadband operators providing affordable service within an effective regulatory framework. However, technological innovation remains limited beyond the market leader as other operators mainly rely on legacy technologies (3G and ADSL). By supporting an expansion of 4G and fiber-optic network by the Company, this investment has the potential to maintain competitive pressure on other market players to continue upgrading their networks, thereby preserving the trends in broadband quality improvement in the Armenian broadband sector.

The proposed investment consists of a senior loan of up to US$20 million to TEAM LLC, a company that was incorporated in Armenia in April 2020 and its wholly owned subsidiary, Telecom Armenia CJSC (former VEON Armenia), a mobile network operator and internet service provider in Armenia which operated as Beeline and will be rebranded to team (collectively the Group). The Group is seeking to refinance an existing debt facility and obtain additional financing for capex and network expansion via a long-term debt financing package of US$60 million.
